column24: one line description
KUIDUM CHOK (I Burn, I Smoulder like Charcoal); Composero Atai Ogonbaev (1900-1949); Text: Atai Ogonbaev; Performer: Zainidin lmanaliev, vocal, komuz
Galmadi, Galmadi (He didn’t come); Text and music: unattributed; Dilbar Bekturdieva, garmon, dayra, qayraq, vocal; Komila Mattieva, tar and vocal; Gozal Muminova, dayra.
GuL (Flower); Music and text: Atai Ogonbaev; Performer: Zainidin lmanaliev

Noleydi (What if); Text: unattributed folksong, Ghazal by Seyyid Ezim Shirvani (1835–1888); Music: unattributed; Fargana Qasimova, vocal; accompanied by Rafael Asgarov, balaban; Rauf Islamov, kamancha; Ali Asgar Mammadov, tar; Natiq Shirinov, percussion
Ay Pari (Oh Fairy); Text: Qadiri; Music: Author unknown
Maye - Maye is a generic compositional form that establishes the modal character of a mugham.
Maye - Maye is a generic compositional form that establishes the modal character of a mugham.
ATTILA KHAN; Composer: Nurak Ahdrakhmanov (b. 1947); Performer: Nurak Abdrakhmanov, Komuz
Zohidi Pokizasirisht (Pious Ascetic); Text: Hafiz; Music: Mukhtor Muborakqadamov (composed in 2000); Vocal solo: Aqnazar Alovatov
FANTASY ON THE CHOPO CHOOR (Ocarina); Composer-performer: Nurlanbek Nyshanov
Bardasht; Bardasht (from Persian “summing up”) is a generic compositional form that serves as a short overture to a mugham suite.
Tarona; In the Shashmaqam, tarona-s are short songs that provide a melodic and rhythmic transition between the principal vocal pieces of each suite.
Torghay (Lark); Music: Unattributed; Shuhrat Razzaqov, dutar
Qushtar (Double Strings); Music: Unattributed; performance version of Kuzikhon Madrahimov (1888–1954); Sirojiddin Juraev, dutar
Raga Yaman; In this distinctively Afghan type of classical composition, sometimes known as naghma-ye chahartuk (four-part instrumental piece), or as lareh, Homayun and Toryalai interpret raga yaman.
Aqsholpan (Lovely Sholpan); Music: traditional; Aigul Ulkenbaeva, dombra
